item.title: Drunk
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

jme:

It’s hard to stop yourself from drinking more, when you are drunk. If you have a big bottle of liquor, it’s not hard to end up like those people. Anytime I get “too drunk to move” is a complete accident. I usually just drink beer, it would be hard to get that drunk in the time frame of a party. But with liquor, it is way too easy to get that drunk. And as you get more and more drunk, you drink it as if it was water. I don’t know how to explain it, but when your drunk you always want more. And when you get too drunk, your judgement is especially bad for this. The only way I can cut myself from more is if I genuinely feel like shit and puke all over.

I can feel when I’ve had too much. I get a slight stomachache, so I drink some non-alcohol containing beverages for a few rounds. Especially when I drink beer, I drink some coke too as it gives you new energy.

Read full topic

item.title: Drunk
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:15, topic:258791”]I don’t have that problem most of the time with booze (other drugs though, bets are off, I might wake up in sweden or tanzania).

Got a couple of epic vodka memories (for some reason vodka literally tastes like water to me when drunk, whereas whisky and stuff at least retain the “oh yeah this is strong alcohol” throat feeling) which I won’t be telling here too quick. The least embarassing ones are the usual stuff, walking into some random dudes garden, hugging his wife/daughter (??? no idea) and then falling over, calling my best mate and telling her how fucking wasted i am and everything that had happened that night, then realising it was her mother, at which point i hang up and found another friend to give me a lift. Here it goes blank, but I woke up on the stairs and he was super pissed at me, and his car was messy.

That’s not so bad though, once this guy we know tried to convert a whole catholic church mid sermon into jews. I shit you not, drinking in the day time is bad.[/quote]

I tried to turn the nazis into jews. It was rough.

Read full topic

item.title: Drunk

I don’t have that problem most of the time with booze (other drugs though, bets are off, I might wake up in sweden or tanzania).

Got a couple of epic vodka memories (for some reason vodka literally tastes like water to me when drunk, whereas whisky and stuff at least retain the “oh yeah this is strong alcohol” throat feeling) which I won’t be telling here too quick. The least embarassing ones are the usual stuff, walking into some random dudes garden, hugging his wife/daughter (??? no idea) and then falling over, calling my best mate and telling her how fucking wasted i am and everything that had happened that night, then realising it was her mother, at which point i hang up and found another friend to give me a lift. Here it goes blank, but I woke up on the stairs and he was super pissed at me, and his car was messy.

That’s not so bad though, once this guy we know tried to convert a whole catholic church mid sermon into jews. I shit you not, drinking in the day time is bad.

item.title: Drunk
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:11, topic:258791”]I don’t get these people. They drink a shitload for nothing. What’s the point in getting so drunk you can hardly walk? The only real reason I can think of is because you are depressed. But from what I know, most teens aren’t depressed. So they do it because they think they’ll fit in when they get drunk. They want to prove themselves. But I wonder: if you have to prove yourself to your friends every weekend, are they really your friends?

And don’t say “oh it tastes nice”, if you drink because of the taste you don’t go binge drinking.[/quote]

It’s hard to stop yourself from drinking more, when you are drunk. If you have a big bottle of liquor, it’s not hard to end up like those people. Anytime I get “too drunk to move” is a complete accident. I usually just drink beer, it would be hard to get that drunk in the time frame of a party. But with liquor, it is way too easy to get that drunk. And as you get more and more drunk, you drink it as if it was water. I don’t know how to explain it, but when your drunk you always want more. And when you get too drunk, your judgement is especially bad for this. The only way I can cut myself from more is if I genuinely feel like shit and puke all over.

Read full topic

item.title: Drunk
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:11, topic:258791”]I don’t get these people. They drink a shitload for nothing. What’s the point in getting so drunk you can hardly walk? The only real reason I can think of is because you are depressed. But from what I know, most teens aren’t depressed. So they do it because they think they’ll fit in when they get drunk. They want to prove themselves. But I wonder: if you have to prove yourself to your friends every weekend, are they really your friends?

And don’t say “oh it tastes nice”, if you drink because of the taste you don’t go binge drinking.[/quote]
I do it because it creates epic Lol’s in the morning/during it. I don’t drink till I throw up, I drink till I feel a little nauseous and continue the night from there. Don’t have to prove myself to my friends… We get drunk 'cause it creates a more easy going, fun night.


Matrika makes videos of the night, some times. (I’ma featured at 32 seconds, 55 seconds and then randomly)

Read full topic

item.title: Drunk
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I don’t get these people. They drink a shitload for nothing. What’s the point in getting so drunk you can hardly walk? The only real reason I can think of is because you are depressed. But from what I know, most teens aren’t depressed. So they do it because they think they’ll fit in when they get drunk. They want to prove themselves. But I wonder: if you have to prove yourself to your friends every weekend, are they really your friends?

And don’t say “oh it tastes nice”, if you drink because of the taste you don’t go binge drinking.

Read full topic

[/quote]
His ear got ripped of because he was sleeping on a broken toilet while he was drunk? What way do you sit on a toilet over there?[/quote]

I don’t know how it happened at all. He passed out drunk on the toilet and fell off and woke up missing half an ear, at my cottage.
